result.execSummary:
The defendant John M Pickard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time, commencing forthwith
Consecutive to: any other sentence
Restitution for Walgreens to be paid in 90 days or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment

Costs and DNA surcharge to be paid in 90 days or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Case called at 9:38 AM
Intern Abigail Kinsheloe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for John M Pickard.  
Defendant John M Pickard in court, in custody.  
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed and read-in.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
90-DAYS JAIL Straight Time
Credit time 39-DAYS
Sentence is to run Consecutive to any other sentence.

RESTITUTION:  $14.00 to Walgreens 
COSTS:  $243.00
DR GOD SURCHARGE:  $10.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid in 90-days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

dated 09-21-2022 from Atty. Brandon Carlson, requesting the matter be set for Plea and Sentencing at the Court's earliest convenience;  
**reviewed by the court on 09-21-2022:  approved.

CONDITIONS:
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.
Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant to have no contact with Walgreens listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Case called at 1:59 p.m.
Attorney Christian Farina in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for John M Pickard.  
Defendant John M Pickard in court, in custody.  
Attorney Carlson requests that the Cash Bail be converted to a Signature Bond or a Lower Cash Bail.
State objects.
Court will LOWER the Cash Bail to $500.00

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.
